text.content: Click a Lesson or Activity to learn more about Brain Development.

As infants, we are born with over 100 billion neurons, almost all of the brain cells we will ever have. Yet our brains continue to grow during the first three years of life.

The following video provides a brief summary of brain development and discusses the role that experience plays in making critical neural connections.

As the video shows, the brain is growing rapidly throughout the first few years of life.

As professionals, you can help parents understand that their interactions with their young child help support their development in every way. Right from birth, an infant's brain is making connections that in turn affect social, cognitive, and language development.
